label: 盤領
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 54th  . Nara National Museum . 2002
説明文: Round, stand-up collars were common on court jackets like the hō and the kariginu. A narrow cloth is attached to the overlapping right and left front panels that form matching curved openings at the neck. It is fastened in place at one spot below the shoulder with a cord. [袍、狩衣]
